page.title: 04ROADS IN BOROUGH GREEN
page.content: The High Street at {Borough Green} used to be a {toll road} and there used to be a {toll} house.The {toll road} is made up of the High Street, Wrotham Road and the Maidstone Road.The {toll} house closed in 1870. Today {Borough Green} has 17 miles of road.The estates of Fairfield, Annett's Hall and Woodlands have roads built in a circuit.Most of the time these roads are very quiet. The old {toll road}, Sevenoaks Road, Western Road and Rock Road are the busiest roads. They are very busy and normally have cars and lorries parked on both sides. The roads in {Borough Green} are always dirty and people drop litter. (by A.Cunningham,A.Geering,G.de Vyea,R.Springett,J.Neill,M.Shallcross,L .Pugh, and S.Moye, all 10).
